modules.comments:
WASM Engine Adapter

High-performance force simulation using Rust/WebAssembly.
Drop-in replacement for the D3.js-based simulation.

Provides 3-4x speedup over D3.js for large graphs (10,000+ nodes)
by offloading force calculations to compiled WebAssembly.

Usage:
```purescript
import Hylograph.Kernel.WASM.Engine as WASMEngine
import Hylograph.Simulation.Core.Engine as Engine

main = do
  -- Initialize WASM module (once at app startup)
  WASMEngine.initWasm "./pkg/force_kernel.js"

  -- Create WASM simulation with nodes
  wasmSim <- WASMEngine.create nodes links config

  -- Create adapter for Scene Engine
  let adapter = WASMEngine.mkAdapter wasmSim

  -- Use with Scene Engine
  engine <- Engine.createEngine adapter
```

Encapsulates the WASM simulation and PureScript node data.

modules.name: Hylograph.Kernel.WASM.Engine

modules.comments:
Simulation Events for WASM Kernel

Event types and callback system for force simulations.
API-compatible with Hylograph.Kernel.D3.Events for drop-in replacement.

Key design principles:
1. Callbacks are `Effect Unit` - no monadic overhead in hot path
2. All callbacks are optional (stored in Refs, default to no-op)
3. Event types are for documentation/Halogen integration, not for internal use

declarations.comments:
Events that can occur during simulation lifecycle.

These types are primarily for Halogen integration via subscriptions.
Internally, callbacks are invoked directly without constructing these values.

Usage with Halogen:
```purescript
handleAction (SimEvent event) = case event of
  Tick -> liftEffect updateDOMPositions
  Started -> H.modify_ _ { simRunning = true }
  Stopped -> H.modify_ _ { simRunning = false }
  AlphaDecayed alpha -> when (alpha < 0.1) $ liftEffect doSomething
```
declarations.title: SimulationEvent

declarations.comments:
Callbacks for simulation events.

All callbacks are stored in Refs to allow dynamic updates and to keep
the tick loop allocation-free (no closures created per-tick).

The callbacks are `Effect Unit` rather than taking event data because:
1. Performance: No boxing/unboxing of event data in hot path
2. Simplicity: Consumers can read simulation state directly if needed
3. Flexibility: The consumer decides what data they need
declarations.title: SimulationCallbacks

declarations.comments:
Create default callbacks (all no-ops).

Usage:
```purescript
callbacks <- defaultCallbacks
Ref.write updateDOMPositions callbacks.onTick
sim <- createWithCallbacks config callbacks
```
declarations.title: defaultCallbacks

declarations.comments:
Set the tick callback.

WARNING: This callback runs 60x/second during simulation.
Keep it fast! Avoid allocations, complex logic, or console.log.
declarations.title: onSimulationTick

declarations.comments:
Set the start callback.

Called when simulation starts running or is reheated from stopped state.
Safe to do heavier work here (only called occasionally).
declarations.title: onSimulationStart

declarations.comments:
Set the stop callback.

Called when simulation stops (alpha < alphaMin).
Safe to do heavier work here.
declarations.title: onSimulationStop

declarations.comments:
Set the alpha threshold callback.

Called when alpha crosses common thresholds: 0.5, 0.1, 0.01.
The callback receives the new alpha value.

Useful for:
- Progressive rendering (show more detail as simulation settles)
- UI updates (e.g., hide "Simulating..." spinner)
- Analytics (track how long simulations run)
declarations.title: onAlphaDecay

modules.name: Hylograph.Kernel.WASM.Events

modules.comments:
WASM Force Engine FFI

High-performance force simulation using Rust/WebAssembly.
Provides 3-4x speedup over D3.js for large graphs (10,000+ nodes).

Usage:
```purescript
import Hylograph.Kernel.WASM.FFI as WASM

main = do
  -- Initialize WASM module (once at app startup)
  WASM.initWasm "./pkg/force_kernel.js"

  -- Create simulation
  sim <- WASM.create 1000

  -- Configure forces
  WASM.configureManyBody sim { strength: -30.0, theta: 0.9, distanceMin: 1.0, distanceMax: 10000.0 }
  WASM.configureLinks sim { distance: 30.0, strength: 1.0, iterations: 1 }
  WASM.configureCenter sim { x: 0.0, y: 0.0, strength: 1.0 }

  -- Set links
  WASM.setLinks sim [0, 1, 1, 2, 2, 3]  -- [source, target, source, target, ...]

  -- Run simulation
  WASM.tick sim

  -- Get results
  positions <- WASM.getPositions sim  -- [x0, y0, x1, y1, ...]
```

declarations.comments: Opaque type for WASM simulation handle
declarations.title: WASMSimulation

declarations.comments: Many-body force configuration
declarations.title: ManyBodyConfig

declarations.comments: Set alpha (temperature). Higher = more movement.

declarations.comments: Set alpha decay rate

declarations.comments: Set velocity decay (friction). 0.6 means 40% decay per tick.

declarations.comments: Reheat simulation (reset alpha to 1.0)
declarations.title: reheat

declarations.comments: Run a single simulation tick. Returns new alpha value.
declarations.title: tick

declarations.comments: Run multiple ticks. Stops early if alpha < alphaMin.
declarations.title: tickN

declarations.comments: Check if simulation is still running (alpha >= alphaMin)
declarations.title: isRunning

declarations.comments: Get number of nodes
declarations.title: nodeCount

declarations.comments: Get number of links
declarations.title: linkCount

declarations.comments: Copy positions from PureScript node array to WASM
declarations.title: syncPositionsToWasm

declarations.comments:
Copy positions from WASM back to PureScript node array.
Warning: This mutates the input array!
declarations.title: syncPositionsFromWasm

modules.name: Hylograph.Kernel.WASM.FFI

modules.comments:
Halogen Integration for WASM Force Simulations

Provides subscription-based API for integrating WASM simulations with Halogen components.
API-compatible with Hylograph.ForceEngine.Halogen for drop-in replacement.

Usage:
```purescript
import Hylograph.Kernel.WASM.Simulation as Sim
import Hylograph.Kernel.WASM.Events (defaultCallbacks)
import Hylograph.Kernel.WASM.Halogen (subscribeToSimulation)

handleAction Initialize = do
  callbacks <- liftEffect defaultCallbacks
  sim <- liftEffect $ Sim.createWithCallbacks Sim.defaultConfig callbacks
  emitter <- liftEffect $ subscribeToSimulation sim
  void $ H.subscribe $ emitter <#> \event -> case event of
    Tick -> UpdateNodePositions
    Started -> SimStarted
    Stopped -> SimStopped
    AlphaDecayed alpha -> AlphaChanged alpha
```

declarations.comments:
Create a Halogen subscription emitter for simulation events.

This function wires up the simulation's callback system to emit
Halogen-compatible events. The emitter can be used with `H.subscribe`.

Note: The simulation must have been created with `createWithCallbacks`.
If created with plain `create`, this function returns an emitter that
never fires.
declarations.title: subscribeToSimulation

modules.name: Hylograph.Kernel.WASM.Halogen

declarations.comments:
Events that can occur during simulation lifecycle.

These types are primarily for Halogen integration via subscriptions.
Internally, callbacks are invoked directly without constructing these values.

Usage with Halogen:
```purescript
handleAction (SimEvent event) = case event of
  Tick -> liftEffect updateDOMPositions
  Started -> H.modify_ _ { simRunning = true }
  Stopped -> H.modify_ _ { simRunning = false }
  AlphaDecayed alpha -> when (alpha < 0.1) $ liftEffect doSomething
```
declarations.title: SimulationEvent

declarations.comments:
Callbacks for simulation events.

All callbacks are stored in Refs to allow dynamic updates and to keep
the tick loop allocation-free (no closures created per-tick).

The callbacks are `Effect Unit` rather than taking event data because:
1. Performance: No boxing/unboxing of event data in hot path
2. Simplicity: Consumers can read simulation state directly if needed
3. Flexibility: The consumer decides what data they need
declarations.title: SimulationCallbacks

modules.comments:
WASM Simulation with D3-compatible API

High-level simulation wrapper that provides the same API as
Hylograph.Kernel.D3.Simulation, enabling drop-in replacement.

Key features:
- Animation loop via requestAnimationFrame
- Callback system for Halogen integration
- Position sync between PureScript and WASM

Usage:
```purescript
import Hylograph.Kernel.WASM.Simulation as Sim
import Hylograph.Kernel.WASM.Events (defaultCallbacks)

main = do
  callbacks <- defaultCallbacks
  sim <- Sim.createWithCallbacks Sim.defaultConfig callbacks
  Sim.setNodes myNodes sim
  Sim.setLinks myLinks sim
  Sim.start sim
```

declarations.comments:
The Simulation handle
Internal refs are implementation details - users interact via functions
declarations.title: Simulation

declarations.comments:
Simulation node with standard fields.
Row polymorphic to allow extra user data.
Note: fx/fy use Number with NaN for "not fixed" (D3 convention)
declarations.title: SimulationNode

declarations.comments: Simulation configuration
declarations.title: SimConfig

declarations.comments: Node ID type (matches D3 kernel)
declarations.title: NodeID

declarations.comments: Link type for the simulation
declarations.title: Link

declarations.comments: Default simulation configuration
declarations.title: defaultConfig

declarations.comments: Create a simulation without callbacks
declarations.title: create

declarations.comments: Create a simulation with callbacks (for Halogen integration)
declarations.title: createWithCallbacks

declarations.comments: Start the animation loop
declarations.title: start

declarations.comments: Stop the animation loop
declarations.title: stop

declarations.comments: Reheat the simulation (reset alpha and restart)
declarations.title: reheat

declarations.comments:
Set/replace all nodes
Note: We don't sync positions from PureScript to WASM because:
1. WASM initializes nodes in a nice phyllotaxis pattern
2. PureScript nodes typically start at (0,0) which causes convergence issues
The WASM simulation will compute positions and we read them back via getNodes.
declarations.title: setNodes

declarations.comments: Set/replace all links
declarations.title: setLinks

declarations.comments: Get current nodes with positions
declarations.title: getNodes

declarations.comments: Get current links
declarations.title: getLinks

declarations.comments: Check if simulation is running
declarations.title: isRunning

declarations.comments: Get current alpha value
declarations.title: getAlpha

declarations.comments:
Get callbacks (for Halogen integration)
Returns the callbacks set at creation time
declarations.title: getCallbacks

declarations.comments: Configure many-body force
declarations.title: configureManyBody

declarations.comments: Configure link force
declarations.title: configureLinks

declarations.comments: Configure center force
declarations.title: configureCenter

declarations.comments: Configure forceX (pull toward x position)
declarations.title: configureForceX

declarations.comments: Configure forceY (pull toward y position)
declarations.title: configureForceY

declarations.title: configureCollide
